text: Louis (Lou) Rosenblum (15 November 1923 â€“ 4 April 2019) was an American research scientist and activist. His works were about the movement for freedom of Jews of the Soviet Union. He was a founder of the first organization to support the freedom of Soviet Jews. He was a research scientist at the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Lewis Research Center. He was born in Brooklyn, New York. Rosenblum died on 4 April 2019 at his home in Wellesley, Massachusetts at the age of 95.Louis Rosenblum, 95, NASA innovator, led drive to free Soviet Jews ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Engineers from New York (state) Category:American political activists Category:American political writers Category:Scientists from New York City Category:Writers from New York City
title: Louis Rosenblum
